title: Scrum Master / Technical Project Manager - USA-TX-San Antonio
text: Profile OverviewPearson has one defining goal: to help people progress in their lives through learning. We champion innovation and we invest in models for education that deliver on our promise for effective, accessible, and personal learning from early literacy, college and career readiness to professional education, through data informed instruction and inventive applications for mobile and digital learning.Pearson, the world's leading learning company, has global-reach and market leading businesses in education, business, and consumer publishing and is listed on the London and New York stock exchanges (UK: PSON; NYSE: PSO). For more information, visit www.pearson.com.Pearson is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer, and a member of E-Verify. All qualified applicants, including minorities, women, veterans, and people with disabilities are encouraged to apply.As the world’s leading provider of clinical assessments, Pearson ( www.pearsonassessments.com ) is trusted by psychologists and other professionals to help them make accurate diagnoses and plan appropriate interventions for their patients and students. Additionally, powered by eight years of science, TalentLens assessments in the talent and recruiting space are designed with one goal in mind: To help people progress. Whether Pearson’s customers are hiring or developing individuals with the aptitude to succeed, our assessments and delivery systems are aimed to provide our customers with reliable and unbiased insight.ResponsibilitiesAs our *Scrum Master * supporting the Clinical Assessment division of Pearson, you will:Facilitate and organize daily stand ups, sprint and release planning, scoping, and retrospectives aligned with Agile Scrum best practices.Track and proactively communicate team velocity and activity during the sprint process and publish frequent metrics on productivity and throughput.Manage all technical schedules for each Sprint (release cycle) for UX engineers, QA analysts, development and technical architects along with the Product Owner to develop continuous product enhancements and releases.Remove roadblocks, deflect team distractions, champion focus, productivity, and efficiency.Generate Agile artifacts: burn-ups, burn-downs, velocity charts, etc.Refine and work with the PO to enforce best practices and maintain team standards around process and execution of work.Manage release plans/schedules, resource capacity, forecasting, and status reporting on a weekly basis.Ensure 'showcases' or product demo's are conducted for all user stories committed to. Showcases should occur at the end of every Sprint cycle to demonstrate high accountability to the PO and other stakeholders along with maintaining the iterative nature of Agile development.QualificationsQualification & Skills:Bachelor of Science in Computer Science, or other engineering discipline or equivalent experienceYou’ve worked at least 2-5 years as a ScrumMaster on highly visible digital projects. Mobile and tablet product development experience is a plus.Hold your CSM certification.PMP certification a plus but not required.You’ve managed large cross-functional teams in co-located spaces.You've been the point person to own all schedules across multiple technical sub-groups (UX, DEV, QA, BA, etc.) and Scrum of Scrum teams.You have solid technical depth; if not, up to date coding knowledge and mastery level knowledge of the entire software development life cycle is crucial.You have exceptional leadership and management skills and can back it up with a track record of successful product launches and subsequent iterative releases.Personal Skills:Effective, verbal communication and ability to comfortably speak to executive leadership teams.Exceptional technical writing skills.Ability to always demonstrate, evangelize change, change, change and lead by example.Analytically adept to problem solving and just 'figuring things out' - getting in the 'weeds' to help the team solve problems and provide guidance to remove roadblocks. Work with the Product Owner (PO) to prioritize work.Excellent presentation, interpersonal, and negotiation skills.Hard working, “get it done” attitude.Highly effective in a team environment.Extreme organization skills and ability to be very detailed in sprint planning and schedules.#LI-AL
